Description: Lower body fragment of Attic pottery closed vase, probably a neck-amphora; two lines at top break, with frieze of rays above foot; reserved at turn to foot; glaze on foot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 75, no. 248 pl. 55)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0849)
